requirements.title: Webhook Configuration UI
requirements.description: Create a management interface at /settings/webhooks for managing webhooks.
acceptance_criteria: Users can list existing webhooks with details such as endpoint URL, events, and status.
Users can add, edit, and delete webhooks.
Users can enable or disable webhooks via a toggle.
Users can test webhooks by sending a sample payload.

requirements.title: Webhook Setup Form
requirements.description: Provide a form for adding and editing webhooks with validation.
acceptance_criteria: Users must enter a valid HTTPS endpoint URL.
Users can optionally add a description.
Users can select events via checkboxes grouped by category.
A secret key is auto-generated and can be regenerated by the user.
Users can toggle the webhook between active and inactive states.
The URL is validated for reachability before saving.

requirements.title: Supported Events
requirements.description: Define the events for which webhooks can be delivered.
acceptance_criteria: Webhooks can be delivered for project, task, user, and billing events as specified.

requirements.title: Payload Format
requirements.description: Standardize the payload structure for webhooks.
acceptance_criteria: Payloads must include id, type, created timestamp, data object, and account_id.
Include X-Webhook-Signature header with HMAC-SHA256 signature.

requirements.title: Delivery Mechanism
requirements.description: Implement a reliable delivery system for webhooks.
acceptance_criteria: Queue events in a message queue (SQS/RabbitMQ).
Deliver events within 30 seconds.
Timeout each attempt after 30 seconds.
Retry failed deliveries up to 5 times with exponential backoff.
Mark webhook as failing after 5 consecutive failures.
Alert users via email when a webhook is disabled.

requirements.title: Delivery Logs
requirements.description: Maintain logs of webhook deliveries for 30 days.
acceptance_criteria: Logs must include timestamp, event type, HTTP status code, response time, request/response bodies, retry count, and success/failure status.

requirements.title: Manual Retry
requirements.description: Allow users to manually retry webhook deliveries.
acceptance_criteria: Users can retry failed deliveries via a 'Retry' button.
Users can replay successful events.
Bulk retry option available for a specified date range.

requirements.title: Rate Limiting
requirements.description: Implement rate limiting to protect destination servers.
acceptance_criteria: Limit to 100 events/second per endpoint.
Queue excess events.
Expose rate limit headers.
Allow customers to configure lower limits.

summary: Develop a webhook delivery system to provide real-time HTTP callbacks for customer account events, ensuring reliable and ordered delivery with configurable management options.
